abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is rated satisfactory,
            and sustainability is likely. The overall performances of
            both the Bank and the Borrower are rated satisfactory.
            General lessons learned include the following: 1) Avoid
            unrealistic project design. 2) Move progressively to a
            Sector-wide (SWAP) approach.;. 3) Involve all major
            stakeholders in the entire project cycle. 4) Ensure that
            core capacity is in place prior to implementation. 5) Ensure
            accountability and continuity in project management. 6) Put
            in place a rigorous monitoring and evaluation (M&E)
            system. 7) Carefully analyze counterpart funding capability.
            8) Invest more in software. 9) Better target the
            disadvantaged areas and groups. 10) Enhance communication
            and information/knowledge sharing and promote best
            practices. Lessons are also drawn from specific components.
            1) Regarding textbook distribution, place a greater emphasis
            on quality control; and ensure a logical sequence in the
            development and distribution of syllabi and textbooks. 2)
            With regard to the in-service training component, transform
            the sporadic training to a comprehensive in-service training
            system.3) Regarding the education management information
            system component, ensure a realistic plan and gradual
            expansion; ensure sustainability, and create a data-driven
            culture. 3) Concerning the civil works component, enhance
            the role of regional offices; involve communities and
            schools in supervision, ensure a transparent and fair
            process in identifying needy sites for new construction and
            rehabilitation of schools; pre-screen the contractors; and
            place more emphasis on maintenance.
